column4: When it try to install x86 version of ubuntu 8.04 (x86 has my sound drivers, and x64 dosen't), amd64 is installed, would there be a way to force install x86 version of ubuntu?
I did, it was running the generic kernel, now after i install it, i get an amd64 kernel.
Linux titan 2.6.24-1-amd64 #1 SMP Sat may 10 09:28:10 UTC 2008 x86_64 GNU/Linux
So what am i going to do about my sound drivers?
They aren't working in the x64 version, but worked fine in the x86 live cd.
Does the x86 version have the x64 kernel within it?
you can install x86 version of the distro
don't worry about that, it's just a kernel title
you've not, your still running x86_64 distro
you need to install the x86 DISTRO, not kernel
it's x86 - 32bit, x64 is 64bit, they don't mix
